Literature Review: Generalized symmetries in condensed matter have garnered significant attention in recent years, as researchers have made substantial progress in understanding the role of symmetry in quantum many-body systems. The concept of spontaneous symmetry breaking (SSB) has been extensively studied, and its implications for the classification of quantum phases of matter have been explored. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of knowledge in this field, highlighting key developments and their potential applications.
